[telegram] <Acura360> Info from User Polycryptoblog:
During the test we were intentionally spamming the network with swaps to identify bottlenecks in transaction capacity.¬† We have gained valuable insights and are in the process of utilizing them to optimize various areas of the DEX.¬† ¬†To give some perspective , the volume on one orderbook (RICK/MORTY) was around 100k order requests or about that of a BTC/USDT pair on a large exchange.¬† Original MM1 handled 3x this capacity without issue and we expect to be able to optimize the current MM2 to do even more.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <polycryptoblog> Staking is term  that is related to the Proof of Stake consensus mechanism.  Active User Rewards do not take part in consensus

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <EXCCellent> it's minting though.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <polycryptoblog> Coin generation and consensus are only loosely coupled in Komodo

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <EXCCellent> Easier to say 'staking' for newbs.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <polycryptoblog> I agree , but it is misleading

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <EXCCellent> true.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Goose432> I dont understand it fully, but its very cool to generate rewards without having to run a wallet, setup masternode or sync up a blockchain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <EXCCellent> True staking has something to do to secure the network, to validate transaction.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <EXCCellent> For Komodo , to receive 'rewards' there also is no locking of coins. As some require coins to be locked for period of time to be eligible for 'rewards'.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <EXCCellent> Komodo coins are always available to spend, with out penalties.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <polycryptoblog> Yep it is centered around user action for many reasons.  The main goal of it though is for early adopters ( 13 years is that time frame , if you haven‚Äôt found KMD in 13 years , too bad lol ) a way to contribute to the health of the network.   Transactions are needed on a network for many reasons and coin production to be solely in the hands of miners instead of both miners and users for an ICO coin has its issues as an economic system.   So combining those two we had a way for users to contribute to komodos utility
